alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued February 01 at 3:01PM EST until February 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS EXPECTED FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... .An arctic cold front will cross the region Thursday night and drive temperatures steadily downward through Saturday morning. The bitter cold combined with gusty winds will likely lead to widespread dangerously cold wind chills beginning as early as Thurday night in the mountains and Friday afternoon to the south. The exact timing and magnitude of the worst cold may continue to fluctuate slightly over the next couple of days, but at least a portion if not all of the watch area is expected to see dangerously cold wind chills. ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills likely. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
